TopicTitle: [PART, 1.0.2] Anatid Robotics / MuMech - MechJeb - Autopilot - Historical thread

Articles.Content: What happened to MJ starting the burn about 1/3 of the burn length before the node?

What happened to MJ starting the burn about 1/3 of the burn length before the node?

Mechjeb works fine, update you version, and check mods to see if one is conflicting with it.

Don't stress it, dude. I think I can speak for all of us when I say that MechJeb is invaluable to our game experience. I honestly appreciate all the work you put into this and can relate to the whole 'staring at the loading screen a lot and then you find out that the tiny tweak didn't work' so yeah.. It's all good, and #213 has fixed the problem I was having. Don't know about the docking AP yet, but you'll get it sorted and I'm perfectly happy to wait while you do. I just wish I could help a bit, but alas, I know nothing about coding, so...
Does anyone have a link for how to add MJ to all pods, i.e. doesn't require an additional part? My search-fu is failing me.

Does anyone have a link for how to add MJ to all pods, i.e. doesn't require an additional part? My search-fu is failing me.

@PART[*]:HAS[@MODULE[ModuleCommand],!MODULE[MechJebCore]]:Final
{    
    MODULE
    {
        name = MechJebCore
    }
}

@PART[*]:HAS[@MODULE[ModuleCommand],!MODULE[MechJebCore]]:Final
{    
    MODULE
    {
        name = MechJebCore
    }
}

Forgive my noobishness, but in what file do I put that?

Forgive my noobishness, but in what file do I put that?

Make a new text file in a folder of your own in the Gamedata folder. Copy the above into it, save it as whateveryoulike.cfg and boom.

I myself use this one:

@PART[*]:HAS[@MODULE[ModuleCommand]]
{

    %MODULE[MechJebCore]

    {

        MechJebLocalSettings {

            MechJebModuleCustomWindowEditor { unlockTechs = flightControl }

            MechJebModuleSmartASS { unlockTechs = flightControl }

            MechJebModuleManeuverPlanner { unlockTechs = advFlightControl }

            MechJebModuleNodeEditor { unlockTechs = advFlightControl }

            MechJebModuleTranslatron { unlockTechs = advFlightControl }

            MechJebModuleWarpHelper { unlockTechs = advFlightControl }

            MechJebModuleAttitudeAdjustment { unlockTechs = advFlightControl }

            MechJebModuleThrustWindow { unlockTechs = advFlightControl }

            MechJebModuleRCSBalancerWindow { unlockTechs = advFlightControl }

            MechJebModuleRoverWindow { unlockTechs = fieldScience }

            MechJebModuleAscentGuidance { unlockTechs = unmannedTech }

            MechJebModuleLandingGuidance { unlockTechs = unmannedTech }

            MechJebModuleSpaceplaneGuidance { unlockTechs = unmannedTech }

            MechJebModuleDockingGuidance { unlockTechs = advUnmanned }

            MechJebModuleRendezvousAutopilotWindow { unlockTechs = advUnmanned }

            MechJebModuleRendezvousGuidance { unlockTechs = advUnmanned }

        }

    }


}

It keeps the various modules locked until I reach that node in the tech tree, like MechJeb should anyway. With what WaveFunction posted, you get everything from the beginning.

Edited April 8, 2014 by ObsessedWithKSP
ObsessedWithKSP, I assume it works normally in sandbox but is limited by techs in career? That's how I'd prefer it.

Okay how does one find the upgrade for the toolbar? I have the main tab for MJ. Like the one on the side of your screen. But when I click it and it pulls out the area that should have the menus options doesn't appear. It's just blank. Will the toolbar update fix it? Can someone give a link to the toolbar plugin?
Indeed it does.
Mechjeb isn't showing delta v anymore. I can get by without it but it was really useful. Any ideas about why it isn't working for me?

As a work around, switch away from the craft. Exit to Space Center then back to that craft again. That's what I do when the RCS starts doing that.

Thanks for that.

Sometimes it works for me, sometimes it doesn't. Sometimes just deactivating and reactivating the RCS Balancer is enough.

For me, then, it remains pretty random for me, at the moment
r4m0n, OP says "Current Version: 2.1.1" right below the picture

I just upgraded to 2.2 (build 213) from 2.1.1.0 (build 197). 213 has an odd problem in the VAB for me: if I add one of the new SLS engines (the 2 3.75m engines or the 2.5m liquid-fuel booster) it breaks the Delta-V calculator. The calculator does not update from that point forward, even if I remove the SLS engine and add any other engine. I switched back to 197 and the Delta-V calculator works correctly with all engines.

Anybody else experience this?
Yes, for me deltaV calculator randomly stops updating information, and in Flight, don't show any calculation

I found out the problem with the dV stats and the new engine. It was a stupid typo on my side.

Get #213 ( http://jenkins.mumech.com/job/MechJeb2/213/artifact/jenkins-MechJeb2-213/MechJeb2-2.2.0.0-213.zip ).

Wow! Thanks!

DV and burns are working great for me now. Thank you for the effort you have put in to make this happen!

I just upgraded to 2.2 (build 213) from 2.1.1.0 (build 197). 213 has an odd problem in the VAB for me: if I add one of the new SLS engines (the 2 3.75m engines or the 2.5m liquid-fuel booster) it breaks the Delta-V calculator. The calculator does not update from that point forward, even if I remove the SLS engine and add any other engine. I switched back to 197 and the Delta-V calculator works correctly with all engines.

Anybody else experience this?

This has actually been covered. The new version of MechJeb has native support for Blizzy78's Toolbar API. If you are running a plugin that uses it you have to upgrade Toolbar to the newest version that's compatible with ksp 0.23.5.

If you have a folder in your GameData called 000_Toolbar you need to download Toolbar version 1.7.1

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/60863-0-23-5-Toolbar-1-7-1-Common-API-for-draggable-resizable-buttons-toolbar

I'm getting no dV sometimes on old engines, not just the new ones.

Also, ion engines never showing dV...

It has been fixed

For anyone having Delta-V problems, make sure you have updated to build 213 of the .dll.
I found out the problem with the dV stats and the new engine. It was a stupid typo on my side.

Get #213 ( http://jenkins.mumech.com/job/MechJeb2/213/artifact/jenkins-MechJeb2-213/MechJeb2-2.2.0.0-213.zip ).

This has actually been covered. The new version of MechJeb has native support for Blizzy78's Toolbar API. If you are running a plugin that uses it you have to upgrade Toolbar to the newest version that's compatible with ksp 0.23.5.

If you have a folder in your GameData called 000_Toolbar you need to download Toolbar version 1.7.1

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/60863-0-23-5-Toolbar-1-7-1-Common-API-for-draggable-resizable-buttons-toolbar

thanks for the fast response.. i reinstalled everything again. clean version!

- copied the mechjeb 2.2 #213 into gamedata folder

- copied the toolbar 1.7.1 into gamedata folder

- starting the game in sandbox mode

- building a simple rocket with mechjeb vessel and controller on it (i guess that should be the point where the mechjeb window should pop up?!)

in fact, there's no difference to the clean version. i'm clueless! i also got no toolbar..

edit: Problem solved, noobish mistake of mine windows denied the .dll access in program files.. thanks anyway
